intro: Erigeron fernandezii, commonly known as the Fernandez's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white to pale blue in color. Erigeron fernandezii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun conditions.
